solution.text:
Let the numbers be a and b
we know
\(A=\frac{a+b}{2}=_{{(p+q)/2}}_\) and \(G=(a\times b)^{\frac{1}{2}}=_{{sqrt(p*q)}}_\)
\(a+b=_{{p+q}}_\) .....(1) and \(a\times b=_{{p*q}}_\) .....(2)
Putting the value of a and b from (1), (2) in the identity \((a-b)^2=(a+b)^2-4ab\)
\((a-b)^2=_{{(p+q)**2}}_-_{{4*p*q}}_\)
\((a-b)^2=_{{(p+q)**2-4*p*q}}_\)
\((a-b)=_{{sqrt((p+q)**2-4*p*q)}}_\) ......(3)
Solving (1) and (3), we obtain
a=_{p}_ and b=_{q}_
therefore, the ratio
\(\frac{a}{b}=_{{Fraction(p,q)}}_\)=_{{trunc(Decimal(p)/q,3)}}_

content.text: Let A.M. and G.M. of two positive real numbers be _{{(p+q)/2}}_ and _{{sqrt(p*q)}}_ ,respectively. Find the ratio of two numbers.
